name: Best Ever Meat Loaf
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix wet ingredients: Whisk eggs, milk, salt, and ground black pepper in a large bowl. Add crumbled bread and stir until dissolved.
Combine: Mix ground beef, onion, Cheddar cheese, and carrot into bread mixture.
Transfer: Put mixture into a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Make glaze: Combine brown sugar, ketchup, and mustard in a small bowl; spread over the meat mixture.
Bake: Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, 60 to 75 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160°F (70°C).

name: Cabbage Rolls
directions: Prepare Cabbage: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Carefully remove the core from the cabbage and place the whole head in the boiling water. Cook for 5-7 minutes, peeling off leaves with tongs as they soften. Set aside 10-12 large leaves to cool.
Make Filling: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, cooked rice, onion, egg, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and parsley. Mix until well combined.

Assemble Rolls: Trim the thick vein from the base of each cabbage leaf for easier rolling. Place about ¼ cup of filling near the base of a leaf. Fold the sides over the filling, then roll tightly from the bottom up. Repeat with remaining leaves and filling.
Prepare Sauce: In a bowl, mix crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

Bake: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Spread a thin layer of sauce in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Place cabbage rolls seam-side down in the dish. Pour remaining sauce over the rolls. Cover with foil and bake for 1 hour. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes until sauce is bubbling and rolls are fully cooked.

name: Chicken Taquitos
directions: Mix Filling: In a bowl, combine shredded chicken, cream cheese, salsa, lime juice, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder until well mixed.
Warm Tortillas: Heat corn tortillas in a damp paper towel in the microwave for 30 seconds to make them pliable.
Fill Taquitos: Place about 2 tablespoons of filling on one end of a tortilla. Roll tightly and secure with a toothpick if needed. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Fry: Heat about ½ inch of oil in a skillet to 350°F. Fry taquitos seam-side down in batches, turning occasionally, until golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes total.
Drain and Serve: Remove to a paper towel-lined plate. Sprinkle with salt while hot. Serve with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.

name: Dairy Queen Chicken Basket
directions: Marinate: Cut chicken into strips. Whisk together buttermilk, egg, paprika, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt. Add chicken and marinate for at least 30 minutes (or overnight).
Prepare Breading: Mix flour and cornstarch in a shallow bowl. Add remaining spices.
Dredge: Remove chicken from marinade, letting excess drip off. Dredge in flour mixture, pressing to adhere well.
Fry: Heat oil to 350°F. Fry chicken in batches for 4-5 minutes until golden brown and internal temp reaches 165°F.
Serve: Drain on paper towels. Serve with fries, Texas toast, and dipping sauce.

name: Lemon Cookies
directions: Whisk dry ingredients: In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
Cream butter and sugar: Beat butter and sugar until creamy (2-3 minutes). Add egg, lemon juice, zest, and vanilla; mix until combined.
Combine: Gradually add dry ingredients, mixing until just combined. Dough will be soft.
Chill: Cover and chill dough for 1 hour (or up to 2 days).
Prep: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
Shape: Roll dough into 1-tablespoon balls, roll in sugar (optional), and place 2 inches apart on sheets.
Bake: Bake 10-12 minutes until edges are lightly golden. Cool 5 minutes on sheet, then transfer to rack.
Glaze: Whisk powdered sugar and lemon juice until smooth. Drizzle over cooled cookies.

name: Pancakes
directions: Mix Dry Ingredients: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Combine Wet Ingredients: In a separate bowl, whisk milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla.
Combine: Pour wet ingredients into dry. Stir gently until just combined; some lumps are okay. Don't overmix.
Heat Pan: Preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. Lightly grease with butter or oil.
Cook: Pour ¼ cup batter per pancake. Cook until bubbles form and edges look set (2-3 minutes). Flip and cook 1-2 more minutes until golden brown.
Serve: Serve warm with maple syrup and toppings.

name: Pork Lo Mein
directions: Marinate Pork: Combine pork with 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp cornstarch, 1 tsp sesame oil, and rice wine. Let sit 10-15 minutes.
Make Sauce: Whisk together remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin, sesame oil, sugar, broth, and cornstarch.
Cook Noodles: Boil noodles per package, drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside.
Cook Pork: Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok over high heat. Cook pork until browned, 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Stir-fry Veggies: Add remaining oil. Stir-fry onion, carrot, pepper, and cabbage for 3-4 minutes. Add garlic, ginger, and green onions; cook 1 minute.
Combine: Return pork to wok. Add noodles and sauce. Toss everything together until heated through and sauce coats noodles.

name: Walmart Deli Original Potato Salad
directions: Cook Potatoes and Eggs: Place whole potatoes and eggs in cold water. Bring to a boil. After 7 minutes, remove eggs to cold water. Continue boiling potatoes until fork-tender (10-15 more minutes).
Prep Potatoes: Cool potatoes slightly, peel if desired, and chop into bite-sized pieces. Let cool completely.
Make Dressing: Combine mayonnaise, relish, vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, and celery seed. Whisk until smooth.
Assemble: Peel and chop cooled eggs. Combine potatoes, eggs, celery, and onion in a large bowl. Pour dressing over and gently toss.
Chill: Refrigerate at least 2 hours (ideally 24 hours) for flavors to meld. Garnish with paprika before serving.

name: Homemade Beef Rice-A-Roni
directions: Toast Rice and Pasta: In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add rice and broken pasta. Cook, stirring frequently, until lightly browned (3-5 minutes). Watch closely to avoid burning.
Add Seasonings and Broth: Stir in beef broth, bouillon powder, onion powder, garlic powder, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, pepper, and carrots. Bring to a boil.
Simmer: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until rice and pasta are tender and liquid is absorbed.
Finish: Remove from heat, fluff with fork, and stir in parsley. Let sit covered 5 minutes before serving.

name: Italian Sausage Soup with Tortellini
directions: Cook sausage in a 5-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat until browned and crumbly, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate. Drain grease, reserving 1 tablespoon.
Sauté onions and garlic in drippings over medium heat until translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
Stir in beef broth, tomatoes, tomato sauce, carrots, water, wine, basil, oregano, and sausage. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered for 30 minutes.
Skim fat from soup. Stir in zucchini and parsley. Simmer covered for 30 minutes.
Add tortellini during the last 10 minutes of cooking. Serve hot with Parmesan cheese and crusty bread.

name: One-Pot Crispy Chicken and Rice
directions: Prep chicken: Pat chicken thighs dry with paper towels. Season with 1 teaspoon salt and pepper.

Sear chicken: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add chicken skin-side down and cook until golden brown and crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Flip and cook 2-3 minutes more. Remove and set aside.
Sauté aromatics: Add butter to pot. Once melted, add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Toast rice: Add rice to pot and stir to coat with butter and onion. Cook 2-3 minutes until rice is lightly toasted.
Add liquid: Pour in chicken stock and remaining ½ teaspoon salt. Stir well and bring to a simmer.
Add chicken back: Nestle chicken thighs skin-side up into the rice. Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for 40-45 minutes until rice is tender and chicken reaches 165°F.
Rest and serve: Remove from heat and let rest 5 minutes. Fluff rice, sprinkle with parsley, and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Blackened Chicken with Black Beans and Rice
directions: Cook rice: Prepare yellow rice according to package directions.
Heat beans: Warm black beans in a small saucepan or microwave.
Season chicken: Season chicken breast generously with blackened seasoning on both sides.
Cook chicken: Heat butter and olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Lightly brown both sides, reduce heat, cover and cook until done (165°F internal temp).
Rest and shred: Remove chicken and let cool 5 minutes. Shred into bite-sized chunks.
Assemble: Add shredded chicken to rice. Serve with black beans on the side.

name: Long John Silver's Hushpuppies
directions: Mix dry ingredients: In a large bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, onion powder, garlic powder, and sugar.
Mix wet ingredients: In a separate bowl, whisk together buttermilk, egg, and chopped onion.
Combine: Gradually mix wet into dry, stirring until just combined. Add water slowly for thick, scoopable batter.
Heat oil: Heat vegetable oil to 350°F (175°C) in a deep fryer or heavy pot (2-3 inches deep).
Form and fry: Using a cookie scoop or tablespoon, drop batter into hot oil. Fry 2-3 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown and crispy.
Drain: Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

name: Chipotle Guacamole
directions: Prep avocados: Cut in half, remove pits, scoop flesh into bowl.
Season: Add lime juice and salt right away to prevent browning.
Mash: Mash with fork until mostly smooth but still chunky.
Mix: Stir in onion, cilantro, and jalapeño until combined.
Taste and adjust: Add more salt, lime, or jalapeño as needed.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or on tacos/burritos.

name: Skyline Chili
directions: Brown ground beef and onion in a large pot, drain excess fat.
Add beef stock and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients (tomato sauce, chili powder, vinegar, Worcestershire, cocoa, garlic, cumin, salt, red pepper, allspice, cloves, cinnamon, and bay leaf).
Simmer uncovered for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Remove bay leaf, skim off excess fat. Serve over spaghetti with shredded cheese and onions if desired.

name: Peanut Butter Pinwheels
directions: Beat powdered sugar, butter and vanilla until combined.
Slowly add milk until mixture comes together, stiff and dough-like.
Roll out mixture between 2 sheets of wax paper to 1/4 inch thick rectangle.
Remove top piece of wax paper. Spread evenly with peanut butter.
Roll into a log, peeling back wax paper as you go.
Wrap in wax paper and refrigerate for one hour.
Slice and serve. Store leftovers in refrigerator.
